header.gameNote: CHICAGO INVITATIONAL CHALLENGE AT HOFFMAN ESTATES IL

article.headline: Ill.-Chicago 75, Florida A&M 57
article.story: prsttw HOFFMAN ESTATES, Ill. (AP) -- Othyus Jeffers scored 19 points and had 14 rebounds and T.J. Gray added 14 points as Illinois-Chicago defeated Florida A&M 75-57 on Friday afternoon in the Chicago Invitational Challenge. Trailing 8-5 in the first half, Illinois-Chicago (2-3) took the lead with a 13-0 run and they never trailed again. Jeffers and Gray both scored nine points for Illinois-Chicago in the half. Scott VanderMeer had five blocked shots in the half and finished with seven. Jovan Stefanov finished with 11 points for Illinois-Chicago and Karl White added 10 points. Leslie Robinson scored 16 points and Rome Sanders added 10 points for Florida A&M. Florida (1-5) trailed 41-24 at halftime. Starting Illinois-Chicago point guard Josh Mayo missed the game with an Achilles injury.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
